reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I made a mistake this time and forgot to book a room with a view. The room was just ok but I'd hate to be round in high summer as it was stuffy. Even the view of the delightful Tuscan landscape from any angle isn't to be sneezed at. Anyway I could still have a drink on the terrace and watch Florence disappear into a purplish haze. The Pensione is a charming and eccentric establishment replete with charming an eccentric guests. Even the cranky breakfast staff somehow made you smile. But the place does need a little money spent on it. The bathrooms are a joke - no charm there, particularly as the door shuts with a wide crack.
reviews.title: Second visit says it all I guess

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What's not to like about Bencista. The place is beautifully set at the hill overlooking Florence. In the afternoon one can sunbathe in the sun, at night drinks are in order. It takes only 25 minutes by bus number 7 to go to the centre of Florence. It's always a pleasure to return to the tranquillity of Bencista.
reviews.title: Staying with family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The owners of Bencista give you the impression of staying with family. The rooms are wonderfully furnished with old antiques, the salons are like private rooms and the food is top quality with e.g. freshly picked lettuce. The prices for the place are a miracle in itself.
reviews.title: SHHH don't tell anybody.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is wonderful. Bencista has character. It's a homey villa atmosphere with terraces, Victorian parlors and a roomy dining hall. Nothing is slick, nothing is overly showy and everyone is pretty civilized — both guests and staff. Meals are good "comfort" food. Nothing fancy. That seems appropriate for the place. Views of Florence are splendid - that's the only word for it.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hospitality - Florence, Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Think "Room With A View", but set on a scenic hillside rather than a crowded side-street.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at Pensione Bencista three times and it never fails to delight. This Italian villa set above the Florence valley is a quick 10 minute bus ride from the Duomo and the center of Florence. It is SO lovely to get out of the heat and grit of Florence at the end of a day of sightseeing and sit on the cool terrace overlooking Florence. It's a good 5 to 10 degrees cooler up in Fiesole. The pensione is lovely, the rooms very comfy with fantastic views. Breakfast on the terrace is also stunning. The staff is so friendly and helpful. Worth the price.
reviews.title: Pencione Bencista is heavenly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Pensione Oct 1-4th. The building itself is part of the Tuscan experience. The Pensione has the style, location, and feel of Tuscany. An old building with multiple rooms, plenty of common areas, and situated in the hills on the road to Fiesole, an amazing view of Florence. For location and a quiet, beautiful, and authentic visual experience, this place is a 5-star. That is of course, if you are looking to stay away from the city, and are comfortable managing the 20-30 minute bus ride back into town, which we were. The bus system comes up reliably on Google maps and the routes were easy to plan.
reviews.title: Very good but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Our room was clean and spacious. The queen/king bed was made by pushing two beds together. My side of the bed was very creaky when I turned and it was overly hard. The bed side lights were CFL and were not bright enough.
reviews.title: Authentic, beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food wise, the breakfast offering was plentiful, but it was also plain/bland and the same every day. Dinner is available on site for a reasonable price for 3 courses (15 euros per person). The food is local and has a home cooked charm to it; meaning that it was tasty and comforting, but not very interesting. The one dinner we stayed for included local produce. Unfortunately, the potatoes and spinach were totally overcooked. So for us this place fell short in the food category.
reviews.title: Breathtaking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: The staff were friendly, courteous, and helpful. It is a family run business and several family members are involved with the day to day functioning of the pensione.
reviews.title: Beautiful!! Perfect for older couples looking for something private :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You are transported to old world Italy, the way people liked to have been treated long ago. The front desk and various service people are all from one family or have been working there forever and they are helpful, charming, and sweet. The room was very average but we did not spend much time in the room. The terrace with views of Florence was the gathering place. We stayed for dinner all three nights, first because we were carless and taking the bus to the city at night was a hassle but later because the food was delicious and the service gracious (and the house wine good). A few negatives... its a long way up the hill to the main road to catch the bus. Luckily, someone from the hotel was nice enough to drive us a couple of times. Rooms are small. bed could have been softer, TV in the room anyone? All in all - I strongly recommend this place for a great vacation experience.
reviews.title: Old world charm and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our Italy consultant, Linda Vogan of T'Amo Italia, booked all our hotels in Italy. And this one was another charmer! Beautiful location in the hills of Fiesole overlooking Florence. Quiet, serene, wonderful rooms, gorgeous views, great food, great service. The bus is an uphill walk (and I do mean uphill) but a 15-20 ride to downtown Florence. We enjoyed our trips to Florence but were grateful to have the peace and quiet of a beautiful 14th century villa! Amazing place!
reviews.title: Wonderful Pensione Bencista

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have lived in florence for over 6 years and my wife and I have been here many times for aperi-cena (mix between hors d'oeuvres and dinner) or for a special organized lunch, and all visits left the same imprssions: that the food was first class, the staff was genuinely interested in their guests' experiences, and the view/ambiance was icing on the cake.
reviews.title: Great place for aperi-cena (light dinner), luncht or aperativo!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For aperi-cena call a day or two in advance to reserve. Like us, you will return again and again!
reviews.title: Charm by the Tonne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife raved so much about this place when she came back from staying here last year that it seemed a must return for her or I was in trouble. She worried I might find it dated or too quiet but she should have had no fears. From the moment I contacted them initially to book till the time we left their homely hotel I could not have been more smitten by the friendliness and charm of this family run house. And I mean family run; three generations and the dogs all played their part in making you feel at home.
reviews.title: Referring to a friend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the Pensione Bencista in late September while attending a wedding. After flinging open my wood shuttered windows to a spectacular view of rolling hills, olive groves and Florence in the distance, all I kept saying was WOW! Bencista is a warm and inviting family run business. I felt like I could have just stayed and explored all the various sitting rooms and stairways and nooks and crannies for days. The decor is perfect, the food is authentic and delicious and all of the staff were attentive and accomodating with any requests we had. The rooms were all unique and had varying features. Wi-Fi was available but the signal wasn't always easy to find/keep. The rooms were clean and spacious. The bed was a little on the 'firm' side for my tastes and was low to the ground and moved easily on the wood floor, but it did not hamper the enjoyment of my stay. This is not a chain type hotel and you will not find a flat screen TV, mini bar or coffee maker in your room. It is quiet, rural, and absolutely charming. Aside from day trips into Florence, the lovely Etruscan town of Fiesole is just up the road and worth going to see. There's a small market there on Saturday mornings, as well as an interesting archeological museum and church. We walked there once, but I would recommend taking the 5 minute bus ride instead, as the road is narrow, steep and has no sidewalks.
reviews.title: What a treasure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I loved my stay at Pensione Bencista and happily recommend it!
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is the place I dream about all year round! Imagine a wisteria -covered terrace overlooking the hills of Florence, sipping perhaps a glass of chilled Prosecco before a leisurely homemade dinner. Followed by the best night's sleep in a country house style bedroom - lovely cosy chintz and antique furnishings. Add the warm and friendly owners, the beautiful gardens - and the next day, Florence - this is paradise!
reviews.title: Beauty, comfort & service at reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am one of a group of people who stayed at the Pensione Bencista on the recommendation of the bride whose wedding we were attending in Florence. Her judgement is excellent. The Pensione is set on a hillside over looking Florence and its rustic, even rural ambience is a soothing counterpoint to the hustle and bustle of busy Florence and its marvellous sites. Our rooms were comfortable, the service is friendly, the atmosphere is 'family-like' and the food was very good. And all of this at a reasonable rate. I recommend this hotel enthusiastically and look forward to returning.
reviews.title: Perfect place from which to explore Florence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a gorgeous place, very relaxed and it feels like coming home every evening after looking at the wonderful treasures of Florence. The breakfast is good and the dinner is marvellous. It is really wonderful to be in such a lovely house, in the country and not surrounded by traffic and masses of people. The dogs are very friendly and definately bilingual. The bus ride back and forth is quite pleasant as you feel part of the place with local people. The management are very nice and we felt very welcome. Wish we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: Firenze perfection
